review: I downloaded just to leave my review because I needed an outlet more than anything. I likely won't say anything uniquely profound, but still, I need to say something. I wish I could be happy about Overwatch 2 coming to Steam, but Overwatch 2 is pretty much dead to me. I want to love it, but I can't just put a band-aid on it and say it's all better. I played TF2 for a long while until things fell apart due to the cheaters and bots (they have made a resurgence but it's hard to go back when I'm scared of losing those great memories I made then) so i moved over to Overwatch, and I had a great time! I played almost until I was silver-and-gold bordered, I had almost every cosmetic for every character including the event and league special skins (none of the Blizzcon ones, except the Sombra one because they gave it away in an event) and it was just a comfortable place to be. When blizzard announced the PVE-centric Overwatch 2, I was thrilled! When all things are said and done I'm not much for PVP environments (I know I play a lot of Siege and PUBG but friends got me invested and now I'm in too deep...). I even bought all the pre-launch packs and participated in the beta, prepared to dive headfirst into OW2. Off the bat they say only pvp was being released initially, then laid out a whole plan for how they were moving forward with PVE (the main selling point, to me at least) being released later after it received more polish and whatnot. I wasn't excited about that, but I was willing to patiently wait. The battle pass replacing crates was a bit of a shift, on one hand you used to have to rely on luck to get the thing you wanted (or buy it with coins when inevitably every loot-box you opened was a dupe as was in my case because i had nearly all the cosmetics) but you COULD get the things you wanted without paying extra for them. Even the league skins you used to be able to get just by watching enough league matches (this may be unchanged??). The new system, however, prioritizes money and so you can't get the skin you want without shelling out money. Additionally, I didn't like the frequency of the new heroes being added. On paper it sounds great, new heroes, new ways to play. But it realistically means too many balance changes and it compounds somewhat, with each hero having to have an appropriate balance with and against every other hero. Each one either takes more work than the last (and also may involve balance changes to existing heroes) or is done sloppily with no care for balance. Also, some players don't have all the characters, meaning some teams are less capable to handle different situations and properly counter than other teams who have more money to burn. There were also several smaller issues I wasn't particularly fond of, and they were adding up. Mind you, that's not even including the ever-distressing news of what is and has been happening at blizzard as a company, but I held onto hope for my relaxing PVE missions that I was promised before I made many purchases. They took away my Overwatch 1 so what else could I do? Then the bombshell, Blizzard decided they were going to be scrapping the plans for the PVE content, just releasing the unfinished content they had, slapping a price tag on it, and saying essentially "this is too hard so we quit". The thing I was most excited for, waited very patiently for, and that they themselves had hyped up for so long wasn't going to happen, "Thanks for the money!". What's worse, is that they even knew before launch that they wouldn't be completing the PVE content and they still led us by the noses until we had given them all our money before they told us. I think it's despicable and a disgrace to the years I enjoyed playing Overwatch. I personally will not be giving Overwatch 2 nor Blizzard any more money or time until they at the VERY LEAST fix their mistakes, though even then probably not. I feel like I have been scammed. I was scammed.
